title: Truffle has many deprecated packages that should be updated

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body: I'm having problems when installing Truffle on my Mac. I put npm install truffle -g on the terminal, but it says that there are a lot of errors
Hey @4x4-16, can you show us the errors you are receiving when trying to install?

Same issue here. 

Example of errors: 
(base) pallyndr@laptop-p7r4odgj eth-hello-world % npm install truffle -g 
npm WARN deprecated testrpc@0.0.1: testrpc has been renamed to ganache-cli, please use this package from now on.
npm WARN deprecated mkdirp-promise@5.0.1: This package is broken and no longer maintained. 'mkdirp' itself supports promises now, please switch to that.
npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported

Because of the V8 engine whims, feature detection in old core-js versions could cause a slowdown up to 100x even if nothing is polyfilled. Please, upgrade your dependencies to the actual version of core-js.
npm WARN deprecated ethereumjs-testrpc@6.0.3: ethereumjs-testrpc has been renamed to ganache-cli, please use this package from now on.
Seems the requirements are very old/deprecated packages, and that is causing lot of warnings.

(base) pallyndr@laptop-p7r4odgj eth-hello-world % node -v
v16.7.0
(base) pallyndr@laptop-p7r4odgj eth-hello-world % npm -v
7.20.3
@davidmurdoch what is the plan from here ?
i have same issue

same issue with win 10 installation.
node -v
v16.9.0
npm -v
7.23.0
Unfortunately there is only so much we can do to get rid of these old deps as some of these upgrades will cause breaking changes for Truffle. We'll have to slowly chip away at them as we can.

The Truffle team will be looking at this issue more closely, to figure out process changes to reduce deprecated packages as we go forward. Some of these deprecations are due to downstream dependencies so we will have to work that out.
Same issue

Very important that the packages are updated. During the first installation, you might think they are errors. I had to cancel the install several time before discovering that the stuff still works despite the deprecated warnings

@eggplantzzz and @fainashalts, could you perhaps use this investigation procedure to make a decision on what to do with the dodgy dependencies: [https://mondotondo.com/2021/11/11/about-npm-deprecation-warnings](https://mondotondo.com/2021/11/11/about-npm-deprecation-warnings)?

As Truffle is quite a popular product, it would be good to be able to install it without masses of messages appearing.

New user experience today: 

>\> npm i -g truffle
npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
npm WARN deprecated mkdirp-promise@5.0.1: This package is broken and no longer maintained. 'mkdirp' itself supports promises now, please switch to that.

added 838 packages, and audited 839 packages in 4m
90 packages are looking for funding
  run `npm fund` for details
12 vulnerabilities (8 moderate, 4 high)
To address issues that do not require attention, run:
  npm audit fix
Some issues need review, and may require choosing a different dependency.
Run `npm audit` for details.

Any dev who takes security seriously should just turn around and leave at that point, `npm uninstall -g truffle`.

We've made significant headway addressing these warnings. We'll likely need to re-assess and re-prioritize the remaining warnings.

Sorry everyone, we're aware of the concerns here and are doing what we can to address it! Thanks all.

We've updated our internal process at Truffle to continually address these deprecated dependency warnings, including warnings for development packages! Because many, if not all, of the warnings that were present when this issue were opened have been taken care of, and because this is now a part of our process, i'm going to go ahead and close this issue. Thanks!

FWIW, the warnings I just got on trying installation just now are:
```
npm WARN deprecated uuid@2.0.1: Please upgrade  to version 7 or higher.  Older versions may use Math.random() in certain circumstances, which is known to be problematic.  See https://v8.dev/blog/math-random for details.
npm WARN deprecated mkdirp-promise@5.0.1: This package is broken and no longer maintained. 'mkdirp' itself supports promises now, please switch to that.
npm WARN deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142
npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
npm WARN deprecated @types/keyv@4.2.0: This is a stub types definition. keyv provides its own type definitions, so you do not need this installed.
npm WARN deprecated multicodec@0.5.7: stable api reached
```

That's so much less than it used to be!

Anyway it looks like @davidmurdoch forgot to actually close this like he said, so I'll go ahead and close it.
Are there open issues tracking the remaining ones?

Also having similar issues with truffle install ("npm install truffle -g) on Windows. After install with below warnings, truffle not recognized (e.g., "truffle version"). Tried deprecating to earlier version of node too, but didn't help. Any idea how to fix?

@schutau There isn't any fix you can apply; we just need to update our packages.  In the meantime, you can continue using Truffle.  These are only warnings, they're not errors.

@wbt I've put up #5858 for the Apollo warnings, FWIW.
Great - just set the path and enabled execution and enabled scripts via Set-ExecutionPolicy and it worked! Thanks.
